forms

Class ModelForm<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • forms.ModelForm<T>
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    EventForm, TaskForm

    public abstract class ModelForm<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    ModelForm is abstract superclass which is used to validate model data, provide information about error messages and handle process of creating new Model objects and updating existing ones. All changes take place when save method is called.

    Instance is object, which is currently edited. It might have null value which indicates, that we want to create a new object.

    Author:
    stnatic

      • getInstance

      • setInstance

        public void setInstance(T instance)
        Sets form instance.
        Parameters:
        instance - new form instance
        See Also:
        ModelForm

      • isValid

        public abstract boolean isValid()

        Checks whether form is valid.

        Returns:
        true if the model data is valid and false otherwise. Good practice is to create error messages using syntax:
        this.getErrors().appendError("GroupName", "Given field was not valid.");

        Error messages can be displayed later using #getErrorsDisplay().

        See Also:
        getErrorsDisplay()

      • save

        public T save()
       throws ValidationException

        Updates/creates new instance of object. Calls #isValid() in order to ensure saved data validity.

        Error messages can be displayed later using #getErrorsDisplay().

        Returns:
        created/updated object.
        Throws:
        ValidationException - if form was not valid
        See Also:
        isValid()

      • clean

        public void clean()
        Method that should be called before data validation takes place. It automatically invokes all methods, which names start with "clean". Can be used to preprocess data entered by user, e.g. we might want to implement method cleanStartTime, which would parse string entered by user, e.g. "2013-06-01" and store it for object constructor invocation.
        See Also:
        isValid()

      • getErrors

        public forms.ModelForm.ErrorList getErrors()
        Method that should be called before data validation takes place. It automatically invokes all methods, which names start with "clean". Can be used to preprocess data entered by user, e.g. we might want to implement method cleanStartTime, which would parse string entered by user, e.g. "2013-06-01" and store it for object constructor invocation.
        See Also:
        ErrorList

      • getErrorsDisplay

        public java.lang.String getErrorsDisplay()
        Method for displaying form error messages as list
        Returns:
        String with HTML containing form validation errors displayed as list
        See Also:
        ErrorList
